column1: People who have dementia may have trouble with: - Language and communication - Eating - Handling their own personal care
People who have early memory loss can give themselves reminders to help them function each day.
Some people who have dementia may refuse food or not eat enough to stay healthy on their own.
It is common for people who have dementia to have decreased smell and taste.
In later stages of dementia, the person may have trouble chewing or swallowing.
Talk to people who have dementia as adults.
